points.title: 4 weeks to review changes for paying users

tosdr.tldr: RapidShare informs you about changes before they apply. Paying users will get four weeks to review any disadvantageous changes. “RapidShare shall be obligated to refer the user to this rule again when providing notification of the new Terms of Use.”
tosdr.case: user is notified a month or more in advance

topics.description: Services need to evolve. But it is important that updating the service does not break the consentment with the user. Updates and changes to terms of service and privacy policy need to be properly noticed to users and to sollicit their agreement again.
topics.name: Notice of Changing Terms
topics.subtitle: Are users notified when terms change? Are they given enough time to find out what changed and discuss this with each other before deciding whether to continue to use the service under the new terms?
topics.title: Notice of Changing Terms

points.title: Rapidshare uses personal information for limited purposes

tosdr.tldr:
https://www.rapidshare.com/#!rsag_ppolicy
> RapidShare collects only the data that is needed to open and manage your account. This data will not be used for any other purpose. RapidShare takes every affordable precaution to protect your personal information against loss, theft, and misuse as well as against unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction by taking all administrative, technical, and physical measures.
tosdr.case: your personal data is used for limited purposes

topics.description: Once a service has your personal data, how much control do you have over how it will be used and how long?
topics.name: Personal Data
topics.subtitle: Can you control your privacy?
topics.title: Personal Data

points.title: Rapidshare does not index or open the files

tosdr.tldr:
https://www.rapidshare.com/#!rsag_tou
> The files saved with RapidShare are treated confidentially. RapidShare does not provide any search function, with which RapidShare’s infrastructure can be searched. RapidShare does not scan or open the files of its users. The files are not catalogued nor listed in tables of contents by RapidShare. Only the owner of the account has the possibility to allow the access to his files.
https://www.rapidshare.com/#!rsag_ppolicy
> Nobody can access your files without knowledge of the complete download link. This does also apply to RapidShare employees. There is no software that will scan your files for certain patterns or the like.
tosdr.case: they do not index or open files

tosdr.tldr: It is impossible to delete your account from this service, according to the AccountKiller blacklist.
tosdr.case: no right to leave the service

topics.description: Once you subscribe to the service, will you have the right to leave it and remove your data?
topics.name: Right to leave the service
topics.subtitle: To avoid lock-in and stay in control
topics.title: Right to leave the service

tosdr.tldr:
https://www.rapidshare.com/#!rsag_tou
> Primarily, RapidShare shall provide the functions listed in Number I. (1) 24 hours a day and seven days a week. This accessibility can be guaranteed at a monthly average availability rate of 99.5%. Periods, during which the server cannot be accessed via the internet due to technical issues or other problems, which are not within the sphere of influence of RapidShare (third party faults, force majeure, etc.), are excluded.

topics.name: Guarantee
topics.subtitle: Some services will guarantee you certain features, or explicitly reject any guarantee.

points.title: Rapidshare won't share information to a requesting authority without a legal basis

tosdr.tldr:
https://www.rapidshare.com/#!rsag_ppolicy
> If we are legally obliged to turn over information about the origin of a file, we will fulfil that obligation. The legal circumstances will be evaluated individually in each case by our legal department. Without a founded legal basis, no information will be given to a requesting authority.
tosdr.case: no third-party access without a warrant

topics.name: Law and government requests
topics.subtitle: How do services deal with government requests?
topics.title: Law and government requests
